title: Senior C++ Software Engineer (Remote/Anywhere)
description:
Collabora Productivity Ltd. is a software company specialising in bringing the innovation created in Open Source projects such as LibreOffice to the market, along with services, long term support and software consultancy. We combine years of open source software leadership with an understanding of the challenges that businesses, non-profits, and governments face.

Collabora Productivity brings deep technical expertise around the Office space, from our preferred Open Document format to many other, including legacy, document formats such as OpenXML and Microsoft binary formats, using modern technologies like C++ 17.


Key Responsibilities

    • Root cause analysis and fixing of document interoperability issues
    • Analysing client problems, designing, and implementing solutions leveraging open source technologies and communicating the solutions in a compelling fashion
    • Annual conference attendance to present progress made to the Open Source community
    • Self starting analysis of limited project descriptions, ability to break complex tasks down into smaller deliverables, execute and report progress against these
    • Assistance in estimation of project costs
    • Implementation of features based on unclear customer input to exceed their expectations
    • Communication with the community, other team members, and customers using mailing lists, chats, phone and video conference
    • Capacity to travel a few times per year worldwide
    • Reliable and timely delivery of quality solutions to clients and internal customers
    • Development of strong relationships with key personnel, decision makers and customers

Commercial Skills

    • Understanding client needs and reconciling time constraints, available technologies and resources and open source best practices
    • Ability to work in a global context with clients and engineers spanning continents
    • Knowledge of customers’ organization, management, product, target market, applications and decision making internal process

Technical Skills

    • Large scale C++ development experience, on projects of > 1 million lines of code
    • LibreOffice development experience preferred
    • Excellent code reading skills
    • Office Suite, file format and binary file format reverse engineering experience a plus
    • Good interpersonal skills, along with knowledge of open source development methodologies and good standing in the open source community
    • Significant demonstrable contributions to components in the open source ecosystem
    • BS/BA or extensive experience in the role of Software Engineer
    • Experience of unit testing
    • Cross-platform aware, deep knowledge of either Linux, MS Windows, or OSX, and some knowledge of one more platform (Cygwin knowledge helpful if MS Windows is the core skill)
    • Experience with Android, iOS or another mobile operating system a bonus
    • Casual scripting in Perl / Python / BASH or other language(s)
    • Version control systems – ideally knowledge of git

Personal Skills

    • Highly self motivated, reliable with a demonstrable passion for Open Source and the office domain
    • Able to work from home office, managing own time effectively
    • Self learning skill to get sufficient knowledge of Collabora's services, business model, project delivery lifecycle and other related technical domains
    • Good interpersonal skills
    • Winsome presentation skills appreciated
    • Good English language skills (both verbal and written)
    • German language skills a bonus
    • Ability to work and communicate in an online distributed environment

title: Senior Security Engineer
description:
Nillion is a web3 infrastructure project based on a novel cryptographic innovation called Nil Message Compute (see presentation at Cambridge University). This new technology enables Information-Theoretic Secure decentralized data storage and computation.

 

As reported by TechCrunch, Nillion raised $25 million at a $180 million valuation in the midst of the bear market of 2022 - the highest valuation for a Seed Round reported in Q4-2022. The project has attracted some of the top talent in tech, including the Founding Engineer of Uber (Conrad Whelan), Founder of Indiegogo (Slava Rubin), Associate General Counsel of Coinbase (Lindsay Danas Cohen), Co-Founder of Hedera Hashgraph (Andrew Masanto) and several other high profile team members. The project has also won several industry awards, including the CoinList Seed Program (see CoinList Tweet here) and Polygon Co-Founder’s Web3 Accelerator Program, Beacon.

Nillion is bringing to life fast, permissionless, decentralized secure storage and private computation that fundamentally improves the way that data is processed, analyzed and shared. The protocol is looking for talented engineers to join its team in building that vision.

 

As a Senior Security Engineer at Nillion you will architect, design, build, test and deploy software and architecture related to the Nillion NMC Network. This may include building our MFA, NMC Signing & Authentication Services, and much more. This role will be research-focused engineering as we are bringing to life a new security, storage and computation model for private data and we will be bringing it all together with the nilToken, meaning expertise across all areas of computer science will be needed to make it happen.

We are a remote-first organization looking to build an engineering team primarily focused on European and US East Coast time zones. Some travel may be required.

Requirements

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • 4+ years of software engineering experience
  • Experience with threat modelling, secure coding, authentication, cryptography and network security
  • Ability to identify and mitigate network vulnerabilities and explain how to avoid them
  • Solid working knowledge of Cloud Data Services such as AWS and Azure
  • Extensive experience working with internal and external stakeholders
  • Have highly effective communication, interpersonal and critical thinking skills
  • Strong grasp of large-scale technology architectures and data flows
  • Qualified to at least an MSc degree in mathematics, computer science, cyber security, cryptography or a related field. A PhD or Postdoc in any of the related fields is a bonus.
  • Knowledge and understanding of cryptocurrency markets, ecosystem and ethos
  • Experience in financial markets/software / DeFi
  • Knowledge and experience in the design and development of distributed cryptographic principles and protocols (e.g. ZKP or SMPC)
  • Experience building and operating online services and fault-tolerant distributed systems at scale

 

Responsibilities:

  • Analyse and build software systems according to the latest best practices of security practices and engineering
  • Mentor and develop a security-first mentality with engineers that we hire and bring on to the team
  • Build and develop testing frameworks and approaches that will focus on formal verifications, static code testing, vulnerability scanning, risk assessment, and other methods
  • We work in an environment where tangibility and flexibility are key attributes that help us innovate. Our engineering team embodies those qualities, bringing clarity and direction to help move new ideas forward. If you enjoy keeping up to speed on current technological trends and have an interest in crypto and security - get in touch!

 

We are a remote-first organization looking to build an engineering team primarily focused on European and US East Coast time zones. Some travel may be required.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours to accommodate lifestyles and a globally distributed team
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Make a big impact as an early contributor to an incredible founding team
  • Work on new problems in an incredible emerging and dynamic field
  • Learn from systems engineering, cryptography, and finance domain experts in a mentorship-oriented work culture
  • You don’t need to be in an office or at a desk to have an impact anymore! We are fully remote but value regular meet-ups

 

If this sounds like it could be a good fit and you’d like to find out more, hit apply below and submit your CV! If you don’t have a CV to hand, you can always download your LinkedIn profile and use that (click “More…” on your LinkedIn profile then “Save to PDF” 💡).

Nillion is committed to shaping a better world in all that we do. Our global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence.

title: Product Marketing Manager LiveChat Apps (SAAS)
description:
.BespokeChat is a chat contact center offering a 7 days a week managed chat service. We are a leader in customer service via livechat in Poland where we cooperate with leading companies from the automotive and real estate industries. The company has an 8-year-long history and experience of over a million conducted chat. The additional field of our operations is selling LiveChat as a product on the Polish market in affiliation model as an official national LiveChat partner and developing three apps created based on our needs and experience as a chat center, which are now being successfully sold in the LiveChat Marketplace for other companies that use LiveChat.

 

Currently, we are looking for an ambitious person who is going to become the first Product Marketing Manager to manage and optimize our SAAS LiveChat apps (Super Vision, Super Agent, and Super Trainer) through data-driven decisions. The goal that we set for the first 6 months is to increase the number of installed apps by 70% and to increase MRR by 160%. 

 

Achieving these goals requires verification of the payment models, developing and implementation of marketing strategies to expand the customer base, strengthen brand presence, and improve customer engagement. Additionally, the role will involve managing app development and maintenance processes as well as exploring market expansion opportunities.

 

Your responsibilities can be divided into three main areas:

  • BUSINESS

    • setting direction for further actions based on data analysis: efficiency, conversion rate optimization, calculating and increasing LTV,

    • verifying payment models of all apps to maximize MRR,

    • maintaining ongoing contact with Text Inc. (formerly LiveChat Inc.),

  • MARKETING

    • finding new ways to reach potential customers ("heavy" users of LiveChat),

    • creating and implementing a digital marketing strategy and communication strategy to ensure app growth and development of the "Super" app brand,

    • widening possibilities for communication with users, maintaining contact with users, expanding the newsletter database and its better utilization,

    • acting as a customer service representative for users and potential customers (questions/problems/requests),

    • email marketing/ marketing automation / improving onboarding process,

    • writing simple texts, making promotional and instructional videos for each application,

    • implementation of marketing campaigns in tools like Google Ads and Facebook Ads,

  • PRODUCT / IT

    • managing the development of applications aimed at increasing their effectiveness,

    • close cooperation with developers on app development and maintenance, testing changes, coordinating new releases, coordinating bug resolution,

    • feasibility study of introducing our apps for other livechat-like platforms,

    • product development of a new fourth LiveChat app.


We expect you to demonstrate these key competencies:

  • Proven marketing experience - track record of successes in developing SAAS products customer base and increasing its MRR,

  • Efficiency - ability to deliver results with full commitment and minimal loss of resources and time; ability to look for alternative solutions, give priority to progression over perfection while making use of data in the process,

  • Data analysis - the ability to think analytically, work with data, combine it, look for correlations, and visualize in order to draw conclusions; ability to design and conduct experiments to test hypotheses, advanced skills of working with spreadsheets,

  • Communication skills - effective formulation of simple and understandable thoughts in written form, communication in an asynchronous team operating only remotely, ease of writing,

  • Self-reliance - the ability to act proactively without being told what to do, bringing new ideas to the company and realizing them with minimal supervision,

  • Organization and planning - planning, organizing, scheduling, and budgeting in an efficient, productive manner; focusing on key priorities.

 

To make sure you fit our culture we will look for indications of enthusiasm, professionalism, a growth mindset, and a high work ethic. This role is going to be placed directly under the company's management and it is fully remote.

 

Other expectations towards you:

  • C1/ native English language skills

  • minimum 2 years of experience in the area of marketing a SAAS product with successes supported by numbers

  • good understanding of B2B sales

  • ability to design product interface mockups

  • knowledge of the basics of HTML, ability to create WordPress content as well as simple graphics (aesthetic sense)

 

What do we offer you:

 

  • B2B contract with salary (base+bonuses) ranging 35k-45k USD annually

  • fully remote work

  • sports benefit (for candidates from Poland)

  • private medical insurance (for candidates from Poland)

 

The recruitment process will consist of three stages consisting of 1) an introductory telephone/online interview with the management board, 2) an extensive 2-3 hour online meeting, and 3) an online/live workshop. We believe that a good understanding of each other, each other's expectations, and capabilities at the initial stage is an essential element of successful cooperation. If you like challenges and are not afraid of clearly defined goals to achieve, perhaps we are looking for you!
